title: Scoreless Collective Uprising
outcome: Formerly marginalized citizens, empowered by the collapse, declare themselves ‘scoreless’ and reject the BCI entirely. They build parallel networks for housing and services, drawing public support and pushing the Council to a breaking point.

events.description: The ‘scoreless’ announce self-governance in key districts, organizing alternative markets and clinics. Large numbers of residents opt in, turning away from official BCI-tied systems.
Directorate attempts to block local services to scoreless areas. Technical glitches and public defiance thwart crackdowns, with some loyalist workers joining the collective.
Council debates deploying force but holds back as harmonist and innovator blocs warn of backlash; minor skirmishes erupt between compliance loyalists and scoreless backers.
Oksana and Rada publicly support the scoreless, drawing more citizens away from the BCI. Minor government offices stand empty as mass resignations spread.
The scoreless movement grows beyond the founding collectives, with mainstream public figures joining and open calls for a referendum on abandoning automated governance.
